verses.roman:
tāḥ prāhiṇod dvāravatīṁ
su-mṛṣṭa-virajo-'mbarāḥ
nara-yānair mahā-kośān
rathāśvān draviṇaṁ mahāt

synonyms: tāḥ—them; prāhiṇot—He sent; dvāravatīm—to Dvārakā; su-mṛṣṭa—well cleaned; virajaḥ—spotless; ambarāḥ—with clothes; nara-yānaiḥ—by human conveyances (palanquins); mahā—great; kośān—treasures; ratha—chariots; aśvān—and horses; draviṇam—wealth; mahat—extensive.
translation: The Lord had the princesses arrayed in clean, spotless garments and then sent them in palanquins to Dvārakā, together with great treasures of chariots, horses and other valuables.
